channel.title: Documentation on Cumulus Networks Documentation
channel.description: Recent content in Documentation on Cumulus Networks Documentation

item.title: NCLU Network Command Line Utility
item.description: The Network Command Line Utility (NCLU) is a command line interface for Cumulus Networks products that simplifies the networking configuration process for all users. NCLU resides in the Linux user space and provides consistent access to networking commands directly through bash, making configuration and troubleshooting simple and easy; no need to edit files or enter modes and sub-modes. NCLU: Embeds help, examples, and automatic command checking with suggestions in case you enter a typo.

item.title: switchd
item.description: switchd is the daemon at the heart of Cumulus Linux. It communicates between the switch and Cumulus Linux, and all the applications running on Cumulus Linux. The switchd configuration is stored in /etc/cumulus/switchd.conf. The switchd File System switchd also exports a file system, mounted on /cumulus/switchd, that presents all the switchd configuration options as a series of files arranged in a tree structure. You can see the contents by parsing the switchd tree; run tree /cumulus/switchd.
